etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From pyrazole + -one, after German Pyrazolon

definitions: Any of a group of compounds which are keto derivatives of pyrazolines; a substituted derivative of such a compound, especially one used as an azo dye or as an anti-inflammatory or antipyretic drug.

notes.text: The chief pyrazolone (more fully "5-pyrazolone"), NH—N=CH—CH₂CO, is a weakly acidic, crystalline solid.
